approach: Option 6: Add defer flag to existing operators, parse top-level operators in .common-repo.yaml

phases.name: Add defer field
phases.description: Add defer: bool field to operator structs

phases.name: Parse top-level operators
phases.description: Parse operators at config root, not just under with:

phases.name: Apply deferred ops

tasks.name: Add defer field to operator structs
steps: Add defer: Option<bool> to MarkdownMergeOp
Add defer: Option<bool> to YamlMergeOp
Add defer: Option<bool> to JsonMergeOp
Add defer: Option<bool> to TomlMergeOp
Add defer: Option<bool> to IniMergeOp
Add defer field to other operators (copy, rename, delete, tool)
Update schema.yaml with defer field documentation
Add unit tests for defer field parsing
acceptance_criteria: All operator structs have defer field

tasks.name: Parse top-level operators in config
steps: Modify config parser to check for top-level operator keys
Parse markdown:, yaml:, json:, toml:, ini:, copy:, etc. at root
Collect these as deferred operations
Ensure backward compatibility with existing configs
acceptance_criteria: Deferred ops collected separately from with: ops

tasks.name: Apply deferred operations from source repos
steps: When loading source repo, parse its .common-repo.yaml
Extract operations where defer: true
Apply deferred ops before consumer with: operations
Ensure consumer ops override deferred ops for same dest
acceptance_criteria: Deferred ops from source apply automatically

tasks.name: Add end-to-end tests
steps: Test: source repo with deferred markdown merge
Test: consumer with: overrides deferred op
Test: source without config (normal copy)
Test: multiple deferred operations

tasks.name: Update documentation
steps: Add defer flag to docs/src/authoring-source-repos.md
Add examples for common use cases
Update configuration.md with defer syntax

key_changes: Add defer field to ~6 operator structs
Thread deferred ops through apply workflow

notes: No new file name - uses existing .common-repo.yaml
defer: true marks an operation as source-side
Consumer with: implicitly overrides deferred ops
Top-level operators are new but follow existing syntax
